content.prompt: Which of the following best describes the trend in the import of raw materials into England from Asia, Africa, and America from 1699 to 1774 as shown in the table?

choices.label: Timber continually contributed the most imports out of any raw material, while the entire category of raw materials saw an overall increase by 1774.
Cotton continually contributed the most imports out of any raw material, while the entire category of raw materials saw an overall increase by 1774.
Dyes continually contributed the most imports out of any raw material, while the entire category of raw materials saw an overall increase by 1774.
Skins and hides continually contributed the most imports out of any raw material, while the entire category of raw materials saw an overall increase by 1774.

unit.text: 5: Conflict, Crisis, and Reaction in the Late 18th Century

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
